title.narrative: HPI/JLMC/BAH Project for Improving Livelihoods of HIV/AIDS Infected and Affected Families

description.narrative: The HPI/JLMC project for improving Livelihoods of HIV/AIDS infected and affected families, will be implemented in Luweero District for a period of 3 years (July 2011-June 2014). The project targets 536 families affected and infected by HIV/AIDS enrolled under Bishop Asili Hospital program Luweero, and will be co-funded by Just Like my Child Foundation (JLMC). The project will improve the quality of life of people affected or infected by HIV/AIDS through mitigation of socio-economic impacts of HIV/AIDS. The project geographical location is Luweero District, covering 10 sub-counties and 3 town councils. The project goal is to improve the livelihood of 536 families affected and infected by HIV/AIDS, to cope with the disease and ensue positive living. In order to achieve this goal, the project will assist 536 families (250 original, 286 POG) to improve on their annual food production and household income by rearing dairy goats and growing fruits and vegetables, improve nutrition by eating at least 2 balanced meals nutritious per day, and receive counseling to enable them to cope with associated stigma and with their HIV/AIDS status. These families will be assisted through training, counseling and engaging in income-generating activities.
